The '''Churchill White Paper''' (A.K.A. The British White Paper of 1922) of [[3 June]] [[1922]] clarified how Britain viewed the [[Balfour Declaration, 1917]]. That Declaration announced the [[United Kingdom|British]] intent to aid the "establishment in [[Palestine]] of a national home for the [[Jew]]ish people", wording which became controversial.
+
The '''Churchill White Paper''' (also known as ''The British White Paper of 1922'') of [[3 June]] [[1922]] clarified how Britain viewed the [[Balfour Declaration, 1917]]. That Declaration announced the [[United Kingdom|British]] intent to aid the "establishment in [[Palestine]] of a national home for the [[Jew]]ish people", wording which became controversial.
The key components of this [[white paper]] are summarized by these quotations from it:
